duck: Carl Jung (1875–1961) was a Swiss psychiatrist, an influential thinker and the founder of analytical psychology.
Among his contributions to the understanding of the human mind are the concepts of extraversion and introversion and the notion of the collective unconscious.
Jung - Carl Gustav Jung (26 July 1875 – 6 June 1961) was a Swiss psychotherapist and psychiatrist who founded analytical psychology.
Jung (2000 film) - Jang (जंग; translation: War) is a 2000 Bollywood film directed by Sanjay Gupta.
Jung (1996 film) - Jung is a 1996 Hindi-language Indian feature film directed by T. Rama Rao, starring Mithun Chakraborty, Ajay Devgan, Rambha, Sadashiv Amrapurkar, Tinnu Anand and Sujata Mehta.

}} 'Carl Gustav Jung' ( ; ; 26 July 1875 – 6 June 1961) was a Swiss
psychiatrist and psychotherapist who founded analytical psychology. Jung
proposed and developed the concepts of the extraverted and the introverted
personality, archetypes, and the collective unconscious. His work has been
influential in psychiatry and in the study of religion, literature, and
related fields.

The central concept of analytical psychology is individuation – the
psychological process of integrating the opposites, including the conscious with
the unconscious, while still maintaining their relative
autonomy.<ref>[[Memories, Dreams, Reflections]], p. 209.</ref> Jung considered
individuation to be the central process of human development.<ref name="Jung's
Individuation process">[http://soultherapynow.com/articles/individuation.html
Jung's Individuation process] Retrieved on 2009-2-20</ref>

Jung created some of the best known psychological concepts, including the
archetype, the collective unconscious, the complex, and synchronicity. The Myers-
Briggs Type Indicator (MBTI), a popular psychometric instrument, has been
developed from Jung's theories.

Jung saw the human psyche as "by nature religious",<ref>Aniela Jaffe, foreword
to Memories, Dreams, Reflections, [http://webcache.googleusercontent.com/search-
?q=cache:j_6ig56piEUJ:www.archive.org/stream/memoriesdreamsre007394mbp/memories-
dreamsre007394mbp_djvu.txt+%22by%20nature%20religious%22&hl=en p. x].</ref> and
made this religiousness the focus of his explorations.<ref></ref> Jung is one of
the best known contemporary contributors to dream analysis and symbolization.

Though he was a practicing clinician and considered himself to be a
scientist,<ref name="Lachmanpage258" /> much of his life's work was spent
exploring tangential areas, including Eastern and Western philosophy, alchemy,
astrology, and sociology, as well as literature and the arts. His interest in
philosophy and the occult led many to view him as a mystic.<ref
name="Lachmanpage258"></ref>
